intro: Pterocephalus niveus, commonly known as the white-headed vetch, is a flowering plant native to central Asia. It is a legume, belonging to the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, spherical pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. The species is noted for its hardy nature and ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it ecologically significant in its native habitats.
